title: Linux restore Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to use the Linux restore command to recover specific files or entire directory structures from backup archives. Explore practical examples and understand the purpose and usage of this essential backup and restoration tool.

meta.title: Linux restore Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Learn how to use the Linux restore command to recover specific files or entire directory structures from backup archives. Explore practical examples and understand the purpose and usage of this essential backup and restoration tool.
meta.keywords: Linux, restore, backup, recovery, archive, file, directory, command line

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Usage of the restore Command

verify.name: Verify the purpose and usage of the restore command
verify.hint: The output of `sudo restore --help` should contain information about the purpose and usage of the `restore` command.

steps.title: Restore a Specific File from a Backup Archive

verify.name: Verify the restoration of the specific file
verify.hint: The `sample_file.txt` file should exist in the `~/project` directory, and its contents should match the expected "This is a sample file."

steps.title: Restore an Entire Directory Structure from a Backup Archive

verify.name: Verify the restoration of the entire directory structure
verify.hint: The `backup_dir` directory and all its subdirectories and files should be restored successfully.
